questions.question_text: Vessel’s name as it appears on the Certificate of Registry: (M)
Vessel’s IMO Number: (M)
Flag: (M)
Date the vessel was delivered: (M)
questions.guide_to_inspection: Date of delivery can be found either in form A of the International Oil Pollution Prevention (IOPP) Certificate or Safety Construction Certificate.

questions.question_text: Date of layup, if any greater than three months since vessel’s delivery: N/A
questions.guide_to_inspection: If the vessel is out of service for 3 months or more, record the date; otherwise, this question should be answered N/A.

questions.question_text: Maximum assigned deadweight (metric tonnes):
Vessel type: (M)
possible_answers: Bulk carrier - carrying solid bulk cargos other than grain
General cargo ship - carrying general and/or container cargos

questions.question_text: Hull type: (M)
Vessel’s operation at the time of inspection:
Name of cargo being handled: N/A
questions.guide_to_inspection: This question should be answered N/A when the vessel is in ballast condition. Refer to shipper declaration and/or dangerous goods declaration to determine the correct name of the cargo.

questions.question_text: Details of Port State Control inspection history for the last 12 months: (M) N/A
questions.guide_to_inspection: Inspector shall record the summary of significant deficiencies and, if the vessel was detained, detainable deficiencies. The records of Port State inspection should be retained on board for at least two years. If the vessel’s name and/or the vessel’s manager changed after the inspection, record the name of the vessel and/or vessel’s manager at the time of inspection.

questions.question_text: Name of classification society: (M)
questions.guide_to_inspection: If the vessel has dual class, select the name of the classification society issuing the statutory certificates from the drop-down list and the name of the second society in comments. If the vessel has changed class within the past 6 months, record the previous classification society and the date of change as a comment.

questions.question_text: Expiry date of class certificate: (M)
Date the last Special Survey was completed: (M) N/A
Date of last routine dry dock: (M) N/A
Date of unscheduled repair / and or dry dock: (M) N/A
questions.guide_to_inspection: Record the reason for unscheduled repair and/or dry dock.

questions.question_text: EEDI: (M) N/A
questions.guide_to_inspection: Inspector shall record the Attained EEDI and EEXI from the Class Supplement to the International Energy Efficiency Certificate (IEEC).

questions.question_text: Date of last Flag inspection: (M) N/A
questions.guide_to_inspection: Inspector shall record the summary of significant deficiencies. Not all flag states require an annual inspection to be performed on the vessel.

questions.question_text: Name of the vessel’s manager: (M)
questions.guide_to_inspection: The name of the vessel’s manager is recorded in the vessel’s Document of Compliance.

questions.question_text: Date the current vessel’s manager took over the vessel:
questions.guide_to_inspection: The date of the vessel’s manager taking over the vessel is recorded in the Continuous Synopsis Record.

questions.question_text: Dates of last two visits of the ship’s manager: (M)
questions.guide_to_inspection: Record the position of the ship’s manager attending, e.g., Marine Superintendent, Engineer Superintendent or Naval Architect.

questions.question_text: Name of the Rightship inspector:
Port of inspection: (V)
Date and time Rightship Inspector arrived at the vessel: (V)
Date and time Rightship inspector left the vessel: (V)
questions.guide_to_inspection: Record the arrival and departure time/dates for each session of the inspection or when the inspection was carried out by more than one inspector.

questions.question_text: Total time taken for inspection: (V)
Date the inspection was completed: (V)
questions.guide_to_inspection: Record the actual time of inspection and exclude suspension of inspection for any reason, e.g., meals, PSC inspection, etc.
